function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Laboratory simulations of aerosol dispersion in a fluid-filled channel may assist in modeling contagious disease spread in built environments.","Impact":"Inaccurate models may lead to ineffective containment strategies for contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Validation of laboratory simulations through real-world data and historical disease spread patterns to improve the accuracy of the models.","Technologies":"Validation through computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations and epidemiological data analysis.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, and policymakers responsible for disease containment strategies.","Owner":"Researchers, public health officials, and policymakers."},{"Description":"Dispersion of infected aerosol caused by people movement delays the effectiveness of ventilation in controlling contagious diseases in built environments.","Impact":"Ineffective ventilation control may lead to increased exposure to contagious diseases and higher transmission rates.","Mitigation":"Optimizing ventilation systems to counteract the dispersion caused by people movement and implementing strict ventilation control measures during infectious disease outbreaks.","Technologies":"Advanced ventilation systems, including high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters and air purification systems.","People":"Building architects, HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) engineers, and public health officials.","Owner":"Building architects, HVAC engineers, and public health officials."},{"Description":"The dispersal of contagious aerosol in buildings may lead to significant airborne transmission of diseases due to people movement, affecting individuals in the built environment.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission and higher infection rates among individuals occupying the building.","Mitigation":"Implementing strict control measures, such as mask mandates, social distancing protocols, and surface disinfection routines, to mitigate airborne transmission in the built environment.","Technologies":"Air quality monitoring systems, UV-C sterilization technology, and contactless access control systems.","People":"Occupants of the building, employers, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Building owners, employers, and public health authorities."}]}
